entry.et: Middle English admitten, from Latin admittere, from ad- + mittere to send

def.dt: :to allow scope for :permit admits no possibility of misunderstanding
:to concede as true or valid admitted making a mistake
:to allow entry (as to a place, fellowship, or privilege) an open window had admitted rain admitted to the club
:to accept into a hospital as an inpatient he was admitted last night for chest pains
